title.romaji: Watashi no Oshi wa Akuyaku Reijou.
title.english: I'm in Love with the Villainess

description:
The world turns upside down when a corporate drone wakes up as Rae Taylor, the heroine in her favorite otome game, Revolution. Rae is elated at the opportunity to court Claire François, the game’s villainess and the object of her affection. Armed with her knowledge of the game and events to come, Rae sets out to make Claire fall for her. But how will the villainess take Rae’s romantic advances?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ทำไงดีเกมนี้นางร้ายน่ารัก

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

name.native: ロレッタ・クグレット

node.description:
Originating from M.S.C.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the CG artist or the sound producer._

A native of Tokyo, Noriyuki Asakura made his debut into the music industry in 1982, performing the theme song for a TV series. Since then his career has expanded in the direction of composing and producing, including writing songs for pop artists such as Hikaru Nishida and Kahoru Kohiruimaki. But as his creative interests began to diversify, he started focusing more on soundtrack composition for TV, anime, games and motion pictures. His dual experience in both pop and soundtrack production makes him one of the very few individuals capable of producing high quality material in either field. Noriyuki's musical savvy is featured in the soundtrack for the popular animation series "Rurouni Kenshin" (1995), and the international success of PlayStation game "Tenchu"(1998) gave people all around the world a chance to experience his unique Pan-Asian sound. Currently he has just finished working on the soundtrack for "Tenchu 2", and is looking for opportunities in Hollywood in which his musical style - which fuses elements from throughout Asia, spanning from the Middle East and Western Asia to traditional Chinese and Japanese - can be used as a vehicle to move and excite the listener in a way that only he can do.    Source: www-n.asakura.com

Originating from M.S.C.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the CG artist or the sound producer._
__Aiko Yamagami__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
__Yuusuke Inada__ is a Japanese sound effects editor.

[Website](https://yu-serizawa.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=229) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000226) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/@iRis_s_yu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/seriko_is_no.1/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu_Serizawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芹澤優)

Yuu Serizawa is a voice actress and member of the anisong and idol unit [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442), signed to DIVE II Entertainment, a sub-label of Avex Entertainment. She is associated with the color blue in the unit.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Nina - Memento Mori (VG)
• Bay - NIKKE: Goddess of Victory (VG)
• Nicole - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
• Gentildonna - Uma Musume: Pretty Derby (VG)
• Asakura Karen - Heaven Burns Red (VG)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lulihorta) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lulihorta)

Luísa Horta is a Brazilian actress, voice actress, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Kirra Foster / Skye (Valorant)
- Female Protagonist (Tower of Fantasy)
- Savannah Miller (The Circle EUA)
- Mary Anne (2nd dub; The Baby-Sitters Club)
- Kira Yukimura (Sony's dub; Teen Wolf)
- Alicia (Stuck 2017)
- Liz Cheney (Vice)
- Oh Hui-Ji (A Love So Beautiful)
!~

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/andrerinaldidub/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andrerinaldidub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/andrerinaldidub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@andrerinaldidub) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB9-DmISWwZaBMmDqK7i2A) | [Site Web](https://www.andrerinaldi.com)

André Augusto Rinaldi is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at Grupo Macias and at DuBrasil. He is the cousin of the voice actor [Fabricio Rinaldi](https://anilist.co/staff/209058/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AngieVillaB) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/angie_villa_barron/)

A Mexican voice actress. She is the recurring dub voice of Anna Kendrick.

She is married to [Carlos Barragán](https://anilist.co/staff/262719/Carlos-Barragn).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Kait Diaz (Gears of War 4 & Gears 5)
- Mel (The Last of Us II)
- Kai'sa (League of Legends)
